author: Arjyani Sengupta
comment: @mYStiC In a realistic world of AoT lemme tell you something. A nation's progress doesn't happen in months or years , it takes decades or centuries of time. They had 4 years , which may seem a lot to you , but it's absolutely nothing in a time and age were communication takes place so slow. The first year went by finishing off all the titans and reaching the sea. The second year went with the capturing of ships and building a port and laying off rail lines ie basic infrastructure for any goddamn nation to function. After that , the first thing which they did was establish diplomatic relations with the nation that's most friendly to them , which is actually how nations survive in real world. And then they went to Marley for that Eldians support conference , obviously found out wasn't an option. I'm sure they would have done something else after that. Remember Marley was in war with several nations , maybe they would have went into military alliance with those nations who were Marley's rivals , for eg the Mid east forces (they had the colossal titan which was literally like a nuclear weapon), they could have defeated Marley , but we will never know about these options , because , Eren went ahead all by himself to collaborate with Zeke without any sort of consultation or communication with Paradise millitary , launching a suprise attack on Marley (which by default will be held as an attack by the Paradise government) , thus throwing all these options out of the window.  From Being in isolation for a century and knowing nothing to functioning as an actual nation within fucking 4 years where many of the military people were having trouble even grasping the concept of nation was impressive and happened due to the big brains you just teased.   And if you think that Historia understands him , oh boy , you're so mistaken. She's clearly disgusted and that's why she looks so depressed all the time . She knows that she doesn't have the power to stop him . And any other method of saving Paradise after the attack on Marley would have involved Historia being a sacrifice. And thus like in season 3 she prioritised herself over the responsibility of saving humanity , she did the exact same thing here. She's just quiet to save her own skin.

author: Hecate the Witch
comment: Oh my God, this amv fits Levi perfectly. He really is a LEGEND. And this song explains exactly what it is to be the one. Legends have to be stoic even in the darkest of times, have to keep fighting even when everything's lost, and have to move on leaving behind people they love when they cannot be saved. Because the fate of the world lies on their shoulders. And we will never know how much it cost them because they keep their own struggles inside, so that those who look up to them could find strength within themselves to fight too. We will never know how much of a burden they bear with their title

comment: @ê¹€ë¯¼ì • you are literally comparing the main protagonist with a side protagonist. Eren is powerful as a manga reader I can say that but over the time we have seen the skills and ability of Captain Levi, his character build up in the story made people fall in love. And I won't be surprised if people is his fan boy. Eren is like superman- powerful, strong and unmatchable capability but Levi is like batman- experienced, agile, merciless and he is a capability to turn obstacles into capability. author: Jachin Choi
comment: Im surprised that the fighters in AOT havent gone insane. Constantly witnessing friends die in front of your eyes, allies being ripped to shreds. Man get PTSD yes, but thats after many battles. They live everyday in a war where they have a super high chance of dying, yet tehy fight. Levi is one of them. He saw his best friends die before his eyes which drew him insane for a while, but soon, after so many painful things, he just started trying not to care, even though he did, he tried his hardest not to so that he can stay sane.

author: Miss Celestial
comment: Honestly, I want Levi to die already. Before you get angry, hear me out. Levi's mom died when he is very young, then Kenny adopted him then left him when he already know how to live underground. Then, he met Farlan and Isabelle after, which is I think is the most happiest moments of his life. But what happened? They got eaten. He almost lost his will to live, but Erwin made him change his mind. He decided to follow Erwin. Erwin died. I'm not a manga reader, but I got spoiled that my fav character, Hanji, died too. Which is Levi's last friend. Not to mention his whole squad(the previous one) died too and he can't do anything about it.  This is too much for him. Ever since his childhood, everyone left him. He already suffered enough. Please let my baby rest.ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­

author: Sophia B.
comment: I love the part when he defeats the beast Titan, is shows Leviâ€™s true intelligence, excellence and expertise when it come to defeating something much bigger than him. He knew what the Titan would do in reaction to all of his movements but Levi made is seem as if he were going to do what was expected of him and then last minute completely change the course. IE: when Levi made it seem that he was going for the nape of the neck, he was actually going for the eyes and he attacked in a specific order that would leave the beast Titan immobile. This is just pure genius.

author: Sasha Richardson
comment: I just came off commenting on Legends Never Die- Attack on Titan AMV and boy, this should've been the first thing I commented on. I can't stay for long so I'll just say that I didn't watch every single scene and as a matter of fact, I skipped a good bit because I either didn't watch the OVAs as yet or I haven't reached a certain scene in the anime as I started to re-watch Attack on Titan back in March because I just felt like it since I remembered how good it was back then when I first came across it within the last two years but what I couldn't remember was where I stopped up to. I recalled  a lot in season two as it looked familiar but I can't remember where I stopped. I'm currently going to watch episode 7 in season 2 tonight as I watched episode six (Warrior) yesterday and now (Close Combat) episode 7 is on tonight and that's why I skipped certain parts as I didn't want to spoil it for myself.      Also, that part at 1:52s where the music intensifies while Captain Levi simultaneously flies through the air with the help of his ODM gear aggressively to fight those bad guys who is Kenny's clan I think is a masterpiece...... just fits so perfectly with the music................   I was also just thinking of how legendary his skills are because we've seen god mode from Captain Levi before but I think what would've been perfect would be Levi going the greatest god mode on both the Armoured and Colossal Titan with strikes that are a mere blur to the naked eye. You can picture it in your mind. It would mirror the fight in the OVA that Levi had with the Aberrant when he discovered that it savagely murdered his two and probably only best friends, Isabel Magnolia and Furlan Church. Let's say that he has to do it well, unlock beast or god mode because Reiner and Bertholdt somehow provoke him with the aforementioned incident involving the deaths of his two best friends or maybe his mother's death while he was a starving child. They mock him and you can just imagine him slowly turning around with THAT crazy, insane, but extremely pissed off to the highest level kinda look to which he swiftly turns around fully with blades in his hand shouting at the very top of his lungs and with tears of anger in his eyes, You dare!!!!!     We could've put more exclamation marks there but I saw just a few hours ago online on Quora about someone giving their reasons as to why they specifically liked Captain Levi as the question was entitled Why is Levi Ackerman (Attack on Titan) so popular? and it's a quick and interesting little read as they stated the tragedy of his past and all that he suffered through and hinted at him having P.T.S.D. and a deteriorating mental health.   Captain Levi is the strongest character in Attack on Titan as he isn't called Humanity's greatest soldier for kicks and giggles. He's a terrifying force of methodical strategy and merciless bloodshed.    I got that above quote from when I initially types in Captain Levi's friends and scrolled down to the people also ask these questions section where one stood out to me entitled,  Is Captain Levi the most powerful character in Attack on Titan?

I feel like it should have ended with the panel from 115 where heâ€™s covered in blood and being examined by Hange, but that doesnâ€™t fit the â€œNever dieâ€ feel. (Letâ€™s hope heâ€™s injured and not dead :,) ) This has amazing editing and itâ€™s really smooth!

author: kneecaps
comment: âš ï¸ MANGA SPOILERS AHEAD âš ï¸  Okay, for anyone who wants to know whatâ€™s currently happening with Levi (Iâ€™ll update as new chapters come out)  While in a fight with Zeke, Levi is hit by a thunder spear.  Heâ€™s passed out and *possibly* dead.  He is immediately found and declared dead by Hanji/Hange after a soldier threatens to shoot him in the head.  Hanji/Hange might be lying (to prevent him being shot in the head).  From what we see in the panel heâ€™s covered in his own blood and has many pieces of shrapnel in his face and probably other places.  Hanji/Hange says sheâ€™s seen â€œsomething similar in a training accident and his insides/organs are scrambled.â€  As I said, she may be lying so â€œsaveâ€ him.  He may be missing an arm, or at least a few fingers.  He seems to be bleeding from his eyes, so one might be missing.  Heâ€™s passed out, when all of a sudden Zeke reappears.  This distracts the soldiers and Hanji/Hange has time to pick up Levi and escape.  She carries him off through the river.  What happens next is unknown.  The fandom is pretty sure Levi is alive (why else would Hanji/Hange risk capture or death and escape with his â€œcorpseâ€?) But we cant be sure.  The creator (Hajime Isayama) May be doing this as a way to put Levi out of commission for the final battle (without killing him just injuring him)  Plus Levi is easily the most popular character in this series so we doubt heâ€™d kill him off. (The fans would have an outrage if he did)  Hopefully Levi survives, but itâ€™s still hard to tell.  Isayama does enjoy killing off characters...
